an10.29:6.3.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni;
an10.29:6.3.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an10.29:7.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni;
an10.29:7.1.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.

an10.29:8.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni;
an10.29:8.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an10.29:9.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni;
an10.29:9.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.

an10.29:10.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
an10.29:10.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, blue, with blue color and blue appearance.

an10.29:10.3.pli: evamevaṁ ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni;
an10.29:10.3.en: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, blue, with blue color and blue appearance.

an10.29:11.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
an10.29:11.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, yellow, with yellow color and yellow appearance.

an10.29:11.3.pli: evamevaṁ ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni;
an10.29:11.3.en: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, yellow, with yellow color and yellow appearance.

an10.29:12.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
an10.29:12.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, red, with red color and red appearance.

an10.29:12.3.pli: evamevaṁ ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni;
an10.29:12.3.en: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, red, with red color and red appearance.

an10.29:13.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
an10.29:13.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

an10.29:13.3.pli: evamevaṁ ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni;
an10.29:13.3.en: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

an10.29:14.1.pli: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ aṭṭhannaṁ abhibhāyatanānaṁ yadidaṁ ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni;
an10.29:14.1.en: The best of these dimensions of mastery is when someone, not perceiving form internally, sees forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

mn77:23.26.pli: evameva ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 16
The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn138:3.1.pli: “Tathā tathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu upaparikkheyya yathā yathā upaparikkhato bahiddhā cassa viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭaṁ, ajjhattaṁ asaṇṭhitaṁ anupādāya na paritasseyya.
mn138:3.1.en: “A mendicant should thoroughly examine such that for the examiner, if consciousness were not scattered and diffused externally, nor stuck internally, it would not be anxious because of grasping.

mn138:9.5.pli: ‘tathā tathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu upaparikkheyya, yathā yathā upaparikkhato bahiddhā cassa viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭaṁ ajjhattaṁ asaṇṭhitaṁ anupādāya na paritasseyya, bahiddhā, bhikkhave, viññāṇe avikkhitte avisaṭe sati ajjhattaṁ asaṇṭhite anupādāya aparitassato āyatiṁ jātijarāmaraṇadukkhasamudayasambhavo na hotī’ti.
mn138:9.5.en: ‘A mendicant should thoroughly examine such that for the examiner, if consciousness were not scattered and diffused externally, nor stuck internally, it would not be anxious because of grasping. When this is the case, there is no coming to be of the origin of suffering—of rebirth, old age, and death in the future.’

mn138:10.1.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ vikkhittaṁ visaṭanti vuccati?
mn138:10.1.en: How is consciousness said to be scattered and diffused externally?

mn138:10.2.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā rūpanimittānusāri viññāṇaṁ hoti rūpanimittassādagadhitaṁ rūpanimittassādavinibandhaṁ rūpanimittassādasaṁyojanasaṁyuttaṁ bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ vikkhittaṁ visaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:10.2.en: In this case, when a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, and consciousness follows after the features of that sight—tied, attached, and fettered to gratification in its features—consciousness is said to be scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:10.7.pli: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya dhammanimittānusāri viññāṇaṁ hoti; dhammanimittassādagadhitaṁ dhammanimittassādavinibandhaṁ dhammanimittassādasaṁyojanasaṁyuttaṁ bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ vikkhittaṁ visaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:10.7.en: When they know an idea with their mind, and consciousness follows after the features of that idea—tied, attached, and fettered to gratification in its features—consciousness is said to be scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:10.8.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ vikkhittaṁ visaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:10.8.en: That’s how consciousness is said to be scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:11.1.pli: Kathañcāvuso, bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭanti vuccati?
mn138:11.1.en: And how is consciousness said to be not scattered and diffused externally?

mn138:11.2.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā na rūpanimittānusāri viññāṇaṁ hoti, na rūpanimittassādagadhitaṁ na rūpanimittassādavinibandhaṁ na rūpanimittassādasaṁyojanasaṁyuttaṁ bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:11.2.en: In this case, when a mendicant sees a sight with their eyes, but consciousness does not follow after the features of that sight—not tied, attached, and fettered to gratification in its features—consciousness is said to be not scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:11.7.pli: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya na dhammanimittānusāri viññāṇaṁ hoti na dhammanimittassādagadhitaṁ na dhammanimittassādavinibandhaṁ na dhammanimittassādasaṁyojanasaṁyuttaṁ bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:11.7.en: When they know an idea with their mind, but consciousness does not follow after the features of that idea—not tied, attached, and fettered to gratification in its features—consciousness is said to be not scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:11.8.pli: Evaṁ kho, āvuso, bahiddhā viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭanti vuccati.
mn138:11.8.en: That’s how consciousness is said to be not scattered and diffused externally.

mn138:22.2.pli: ‘tathā tathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu upaparikkheyya yathā yathā upaparikkhato bahiddhā cassa viññāṇaṁ avikkhittaṁ avisaṭaṁ, ajjhattaṁ asaṇṭhitaṁ anupādāya na paritasseyya.
mn138:22.2.en: ‘A mendicant should thoroughly examine such that for the examiner, if consciousness were not scattered and diffused externally, nor stuck internally, it would not be anxious because of grasping.

an6.118:1.15.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharitun”ti.
an6.118:1.15.en: After giving up these six qualities you can meditate observing an aspect of principles internally and externally.”

dn34:2.1.161.pli: ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti—
dn34:2.1.161.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn34:2.1.164.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn34:2.1.167.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn34:2.1.170.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti—
dn34:2.1.170.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn34:2.1.173.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
dn34:2.1.173.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are blue, with blue color and blue appearance.

dn34:2.1.177.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
dn34:2.1.177.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are yellow, with yellow color and yellow appearance.

dn34:2.1.181.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
dn34:2.1.181.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are red, with red color and red appearance.

dn34:2.1.185.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
dn34:2.1.185.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are white, with white color and white appearance.

dn34:2.1.194.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati.
dn34:2.1.194.en: Not perceiving physical form internally, someone see forms externally.

dn33:3.1.143.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
dn33:3.1.143.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn33:3.1.145.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti—
dn33:3.1.145.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn33:3.1.148.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
dn33:3.1.148.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn33:3.1.150.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, ‘tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
dn33:3.1.150.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

dn33:3.1.152.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
dn33:3.1.152.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are blue, with blue color and blue appearance.

dn33:3.1.156.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
dn33:3.1.156.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are yellow, with yellow color and yellow appearance.

dn33:3.1.160.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
dn33:3.1.160.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are red, with red color and red appearance.

dn33:3.1.164.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
dn33:3.1.164.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally that are white, with white color and white appearance.

dn33:3.1.171.en: Not perceiving physical form internally, they see forms externally.

sn52.2:4.2.en: They meditate observing an aspect of the body externally …

sn52.2:4.3.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.2:4.3.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn52.2:5.2.pli: Bahiddhā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.

sn52.2:5.3.pli: Ajjhattabahiddhā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.

sn52.2:6.3.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā citte cittānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.

sn52.2:7.3.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.2:7.3.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

an8.65:1.3.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
an8.65:1.3.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an8.65:2.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
an8.65:2.1.en: Perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.

an8.65:3.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
an8.65:3.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an8.65:4.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
an8.65:4.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.

an8.65:5.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
an8.65:5.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, blue, with blue color and blue appearance.

an8.65:6.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
an8.65:6.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, yellow, with yellow color and yellow appearance.

an8.65:7.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
an8.65:7.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, red, with red color and red appearance.

an8.65:8.1.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
an8.65:8.1.en: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

sn47.3:2.3.pli: bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharāhi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ;
sn47.3:2.3.en: Or meditate observing an aspect of the body externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn47.3:2.4.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharāhi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn47.3:2.4.en: Or meditate observing an aspect of the body internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn47.3:2.7.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharāhi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn47.3:2.7.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn47.3:2.10.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā vā citte cittānupassī viharāhi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn47.3:2.10.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn47.3:2.13.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharāhi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn47.3:2.13.en: internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn52.1:3.2.pli: Bahiddhā kāye samudayadhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā kāye vayadhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā kāye samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.1:3.2.en: They meditate observing the body externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn52.1:3.3.pli: Ajjhattabahiddhā kāye samudayadhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā kāye vayadhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā kāye samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.1:3.3.en: They meditate observing the body internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.

sn52.1:5.2.pli: Bahiddhā vedanāsu samudayadhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vedanāsu vayadhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vedanāsu samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.

sn52.1:5.3.pli: Ajjhattabahiddhā vedanāsu samudayadhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vedanāsu vayadhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vedanāsu samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.1:5.3.en: internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish …

sn52.1:7.3.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā citte samudayadhammānupassī viharati … ajjhattabahiddhā citte vayadhammānupassī viharati … ajjhattabahiddhā citte samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī …pe… abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.1:7.3.en: internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish …

sn52.1:9.3.pli: ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu samudayadhammānupassī viharati … ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu vayadhammānupassī viharati … ajjhattabahiddhā dhammesu samudayavayadhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
sn52.1:9.3.en: internally and externally as liable to originate, as liable to vanish, and as liable to originate and vanish …

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 52.1
1. In Private
In Private (1st)

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn51.20:2.3.pli: iti me chando na ca atilīno bhavissati, na ca atippaggahito bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhitto bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhitto bhavissati.
sn51.20:2.3.en: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

sn51.20:2.12.pli: iti me vīmaṁsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati.
sn51.20:2.12.en: They think: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

sn51.20:6.1.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhitto chando?
sn51.20:6.1.en: And what is enthusiasm that’s scattered externally?

sn51.20:6.2.pli: Yo, bhikkhave, chando bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhitto anuvisaṭo—
sn51.20:6.2.en: It’s when enthusiasm is frequently scattered and diffused externally on account of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

sn51.20:6.3.pli: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhitto chando.
sn51.20:6.3.en: This is called enthusiasm scattered externally.

sn51.20:23.1.pli: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittā vīmaṁsā?
sn51.20:23.1.en: And what is inquiry that’s scattered externally?

sn51.20:23.2.pli: Yā, bhikkhave, vīmaṁsā bahiddhā pañca kāmaguṇe ārabbha anuvikkhittā anuvisaṭā—
sn51.20:23.2.en: It’s when inquiry is frequently scattered and diffused externally on account of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

sn51.20:23.3.pli: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, bahiddhā vikkhittā vīmaṁsā …pe…
sn51.20:23.3.en: This is called inquiry scattered externally. …

mn10:5.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati;
mn10:5.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:7.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati;
mn10:7.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:31.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati;
mn10:31.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:33.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati;
mn10:33.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:35.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā citte cittānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā citte cittānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā citte cittānupassī viharati;
mn10:35.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:37.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati;
mn10:37.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:43.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati;
mn10:43.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

mn10:45.1.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati;
mn10:45.1.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:2.11.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati.
dn22:2.11.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:3.3.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati.
dn22:3.3.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:10.6.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati.
dn22:10.6.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:11.11.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati.
dn22:11.11.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of feelings internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:12.18.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā citte cittānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā citte cittānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā citte cittānupassī viharati.
dn22:12.18.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of the mind internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:13.9.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati.
dn22:13.9.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:16.10.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati.
dn22:16.10.en: And so they meditate observing an aspect of principles internally, externally, and both internally and externally.

dn22:21.38.pli: Iti ajjhattaṁ vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati, ajjhattabahiddhā vā dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati.

an8.119:1.3.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni,
an8.119:1.3.en: Perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

an8.119:1.5.pli: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.5.en: Perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.6.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.6.en: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.7.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya ‘jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
an8.119:1.7.en: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. …

an8.119:1.8.pli: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni
an8.119:1.8.en: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, blue, with blue color and blue appearance. …

an8.119:1.11.en: Not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally, white, with white color and white appearance.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 8
11. Abbreviated Texts Beginning With Greed
Untitled Discourse on Greed (2nd)

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn47.10:6.3.pli: Tassa kāye kāyānupassino viharato kāyārammaṇo vā uppajjati kāyasmiṁ pariḷāho, cetaso vā līnattaṁ, bahiddhā vā cittaṁ vikkhipati.
sn47.10:6.3.en: As they meditate observing an aspect of the body, based on the body there arises physical tension, or mental sluggishness, or the mind is externally scattered.

sn47.10:7.4.pli: Tassa dhammesu dhammānupassino viharato dhammārammaṇo vā uppajjati kāyasmiṁ pariḷāho, cetaso vā līnattaṁ, bahiddhā vā cittaṁ vikkhipati.
sn47.10:7.4.en: As they meditate observing an aspect of principles, based on principles there arises physical tension, or mental sluggishness, or the mind is externally scattered.

sn47.10:8.2.pli: Bahiddhā, ānanda, bhikkhu cittaṁ appaṇidhāya ‘appaṇihitaṁ me bahiddhā cittan’ti pajānāti.
sn47.10:8.2.en: Not directing their mind externally, a mendicant understands: ‘My mind is not directed externally.’

sn47.10:8.5.pli: Bahiddhā, ānanda, bhikkhu cittaṁ appaṇidhāya ‘appaṇihitaṁ me bahiddhā cittan’ti pajānāti.
sn47.10:8.5.en: Not directing their mind externally, a mendicant understands: ‘My mind is not directed externally.’

sn47.10:8.8.pli: Bahiddhā, ānanda, bhikkhu cittaṁ appaṇidhāya ‘appaṇihitaṁ me bahiddhā cittan’ti pajānāti.
sn47.10:8.8.en: Not directing their mind externally, a mendicant understands: ‘My mind is not directed externally.’

sn47.10:8.11.pli: Bahiddhā, ānanda, bhikkhu cittaṁ appaṇidhāya ‘appaṇihitaṁ me bahiddhā cittan’ti pajānāti.
sn47.10:8.11.en: Not directing their mind externally, a mendicant understands: ‘My mind is not directed externally.’

The Nuns’ Quarters

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an2.36:1.8.en: “I will teach you about a person fettered internally and one fettered externally.

an2.36:3.1.en: Who is a person fettered externally?

an2.36:3.6.pli: Ayaṁ vuccatāvuso, bahiddhāsaṁyojano puggalo anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattaṁ.
an2.36:3.6.en: This is called a person who is fettered externally, a non-returner, who does not come back to this place.

an2.36:4.8.pli: Ayaṁ vuccatāvuso, bahiddhāsaṁyojano puggalo anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattan”ti.
an2.36:4.8.en: This is called a person who is fettered externally, a non-returner, who does not come back to this place.”

Middle Discourses 122
The Longer Discourse on Emptiness

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

dn18:26.8.pli: So tattha sammā samāhito sammā vippasanno bahiddhā parakāye ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
dn18:26.8.en: Then they give rise to knowledge and vision of other people’s bodies externally.

dn18:26.10.en: Then they give rise to knowledge and vision of other people’s feelings externally.

dn18:26.12.en: Then they give rise to knowledge and vision of other people’s minds externally.

dn18:26.15.pli: So tattha sammā samāhito sammā vippasanno bahiddhā paradhammesu ñāṇadassanaṁ abhinibbatteti.
dn18:26.15.en: Then they give rise to knowledge and vision of other people’s principles externally.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 18
With Janavasabha

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn22:18.2.pli: “siyā nu kho, bhante, bahiddhā asati paritassanā”ti?
mn22:18.2.en: “Sir, can there be anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally?”

mn22:18.8.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati paritassanā hotī”ti.
mn22:18.8.en: That’s how there is anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally.”

mn22:19.1.en: “But can there be no anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally?”

mn22:19.7.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhu, bahiddhā asati aparitassanā hotī”ti.
mn22:19.7.en: That’s how there is no anxiety about what doesn’t exist externally.”

mlDocs.title:

The Simile of the Cobra

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn51.12:1.4.pli: iti me chando na ca atilīno bhavissati, na ca atippaggahito bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhitto bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhitto bhavissati.
sn51.12:1.4.en: They think: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

sn51.12:2.4.pli: iti me vīmaṁsā na ca atilīnā bhavissati, na ca atippaggahitā bhavissati, na ca ajjhattaṁ saṅkhittā bhavissati, na ca bahiddhā vikkhittā bhavissati.
sn51.12:2.4.en: They think: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither constricted internally nor scattered externally.’

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 51.11
2. Shaking the Stilt Longhouse
Before

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an8.120:1.3.pli: Rūpī rūpāni passati, ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati, subhanteva adhimutto hoti, sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati—
an8.120:1.3.en: Having physical form, they see forms … not perceiving form internally, they see forms externally … they’re focused only on beauty … going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness … going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness … going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception … going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling …

iti94:2.1.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant should examine in any such a way that their consciousness is neither scattered and diffused externally nor stuck internally, and they are not anxious because of grasping.
